p: This genus, Chrysanthemum L. ( Dendranthema (DC.)) belongs to the family Asteraceae, and comprises about 40 species, widely distributed in Asia, mainly in Mongolia, China and Japan, and eastern Europe. Nowadays, most of these plants are cultivated as ornamentals in the whole world [ 8]. C. morifolium Ramat. (Jiu Hua) and C. indicum L. (Ye Jiu Hua) are common in China [ 9]. They are generally perennial herbs or subshrubs with aromatic alternate, lobed or serrate leaves. Capitula are corymbs or solitary with yellow, 5-lobed corolla disc florets meanwhile ray florets are white, pink or yellowish and achenes are obvoid with 5â€“8 ribs [ 10, 11].
